intro: Gnaphalium celosioides, commonly known as the silky everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that are surrounded by finely hairy, glandular leaves. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert scrub and grassland environments. Gnaphalium celosioides is known for its ability to retain moisture and its use in traditional herbal remedies.
